column1:
◇ ~せい: means because of or due to.  
・This is used to indicate the cause of a negative result or situation. 
・Often implies the speaker’s criticism or complaint towards the cause. 
・It is usually attached to a noun or a verb in the plain form.  
・雨のせいで試合が中止になった。The game was canceled due to the rain.  
・彼のせいで遅刻した。I was late because of him.  
・勉強しなかったせいで試験に落ちた。I failed the exam because I didn’t study. 
・君がした選択のせいでね。Because of the choices you made. 
・テストの結果が悪かったのはしっかり勉強しなかったせいだ。The bad test results were due to not studying hard enough.  
・道にあった石のせいで転んでけがをしてしまった。A stone on the road caused him to fall and injure himself.
・雨が降り続いたせいで、夏祭りが中止になった。The summer festival was canceled because of the continuous rain.

◇ ~おかげ: means thanks to or owing to.  
・This is used to indicate the cause of a positive result or situation. 
・Often implies the speaker’s gratitude or appreciation towards the cause.   
・It is usually attached to a noun or a verb in the plain form.  
・先生のおかげで英語が上達した。I improved my English thanks to my teacher.  
・運動のおかげで健康になった。I became healthy because of exercise.  
・友達のおかげで楽しい時間を過ごした。I had a good time because of my friends. 
・それもすべて感謝のおかげです。It is all thanks to you. 
・彼は勤勉のおかげで成功した。He succeeded because of his diligence. 
・これはハイパースレッディング技術のおかげで可能です。This is possible thanks to hyper-threading technology. 
・みんなの応援のおかげで苦しくても最後まで走ることができた。Thanks to everyone's support, I was able to run to the end even though it was painful.

◇ ~もの: means because or since.  
・This is used to indicate the reason or cause of something especially when it is obvious or self-evident. 
・Can also imply an excuse or justification for something.  
・It is usually attached to a verb in the plain form.  
・子供なもので、わからないことが多い。Since I’m a child, there are many things I don’t understand.  
・病気なものだから、休ませてください。Please let me rest because I’m sick.  
・好きなものだから、食べすぎた。I ate too much because I liked it. 
・久しぶりの買い物だったもので、つい買い過ぎてしまいました。It had been a long time since I had shopped, and I ended up buying too much.  
・宿題を忘れてしまったものだから、先生に怒られてしまった。I forgot to do my homework, so the teacher got mad at me.  
・今日は忙しいもので、電話に出られません。I am busy today and will not be able to answer the phone.

◇ ~のだから: means because or since.  
・This is used to emphasize the reason or cause of something especially when it is obvious or self-evident. 
・Express a strong feeling or opinion based on a known fact or reason 
・Used to assert one’s opinion or attitude often with a request or demand for the listener. 
・It is usually attached to a noun or a verb in the plain form, followed by のだから.  
・先生なのだから、教えてください。Please teach me since you are a teacher.  
・約束したのだから、守ってください。Please keep your promise because you promised.  
・親友なのだから、信じてください。Please believe me since you are my best friend. 
・あなたは私の友達なのだから、正直に言ってください。You are my friend, so please tell me the truth. 
・彼は初心者なのだから、失敗するのは当たり前です。He is a beginner, so it is natural that he fails. 
・このケーキは美味しいのだから、食べてみて。This cake is delicious, so try it.

◇ ~をきっかけに: means triggered by, taking something as an opportunity, on the occasion of or starting from.  
・This is used to indicate the trigger or opportunity for something to happen or change. 
・Focus on something happened as a result of an event or situation that served as a trigger or opportunity. 
・It is usually attached to a noun, followed by をきっかけに.  
・留学をきっかけに英語を勉強した。I studied English taking studying abroad as an opportunity.  
・出会いをきっかけに恋に落ちた。I fell in love on the occasion of meeting him/her.  
・事故をきっかけに運転をやめた。I stopped driving after the accident. 
・この映画は面白いのをきっかけに、ヒットした。This movie became a hit because it was interesting. 
・彼は有名なのをきっかけに、テレビに出るようになった。He started appearing on TV after becoming famous. 
・コロナウイルス の流行 をきっかけに 、オンラインでの仕事や勉強が増えた。As a result of the spread of the coronavirus, online work and study increased.

◇ ~がきっかけで: means means triggered by, because of or due to.  
・This is used to express that something happened as a result of an event or situation that served as a trigger or opportunity.  
・Focus on the event or situation that caused something to happen.  
・It is usually attached to a noun, followed by をきっかけに. 
・彼との出会いがきっかけで、私は音楽に興味を持つようになった。I became interested in music triggered by meeting him. 
・風邪をひいたことがきっかけで、健康に気をつけるようになった。I started to take care of my health, triggered by catching a cold. 
・留学生と話したことがきっかけで、英語の勉強を始めた。I started studying English, triggered by talking to an exchange student. 
・彼とは友達の紹介がきっかけで知り合った。I met him through a friend’s introduction. 
・地震がきっかけで、彼らは家を引っ越すことにした。They decided to move out of their house because of the earthquake. 
・その本を読んだのがきっかけで、彼女は作家になりたいと思った。She wanted to become a writer after reading that book.

◇ ~わけだ: means that’s why or it means that.  
・This is used to indicate the logical conclusion or reason for something based on the previous context, common knowledges, some evidence or premise. 
・To mark a reason or cause for some matter. To mark an explanation or justification of some situation or information. 
・To mark an acceptance or acknowledgement of some truth. To mark a confirmation or expectation of the listener’s understanding or agreement. 
・It is usually attached to a noun or a verb in the plain form, followed by わけだ.  
・彼は日本人です。日本語が話せるわけです。He is Japanese. That’s why he can speak Japanese.  
・この店は人気があります。いつも混んでいるわけです。This store is popular. It means that it is always crowded.  
・明日は試験です。勉強しなければならないわけです。Tomorrow is the exam. That’s why I have to study. 
・今日は日曜日なので、学校は休みな わけだ。Today is Sunday, so the school is closed as a result. 
・この店は安くて美味しい わけだから、いつも混んでいるんだ。This shop is cheap and delicious, so that’s why it’s always crowded. 
・今日は早く帰らないといけないわけだ。明日は大事な試験があるんだ。The reason is, I have to go home early today. I have an important test tomorrow.

◇ ~以来: means since or ever since.  
・This is used to indicate the starting point of a period of time, until the present or another point in time.  
・Used to indicate that something has continued or changed from a certain point of time until now.  
・It is usually attached to a noun or a verb in te-form, followed by 以来.  
・私は彼に会って以来好きになりました。I liked him since I met him.  
・彼女は子供のときピアノを習い始めて以来ずっと弾いています。She has been playing piano ever since she started learning it when she was a child.  
・当社は設立以来、毎年業績が右肩上がりだ。Since its establishment, the company's performance has steadily increased every year. 
・この研究がきっかけで酵素について学ぶこととなった。This research led him to learn about enzymes. 
・ドラマを見た のがきっかけで 、韓国語に興味を持った。I became interested in Korean after watching a drama. 
・絵を描いた のがきっかけで 、美術の才能に気づいた。I realized my artistic talent after drawing a picture.

◇ ~によって: means depending on, due to or according to.  
・This is used to indicate the agent, method, cause or degree of something. 
・Used to express the cause or reason of something, especially when it is negative or unfavourable. 
・It is usually attached to a noun, followed by によって.  
・この本は彼によって書かれました。This book was written by him.  
・結果は人によって違います。The results vary depending on the person.  
・地震は台風によって引き起こされました。The earthquake was caused by the typhoon. 
・病気の流行によって、生活や仕事の仕方が大きく変わった。The disease epidemic has changed the way we live and work. 
・この本と出会ったことによって、本を読む楽しさがわかった。I discovered the joy of reading books when I came across this book.  
・大雪により、いくつかの道が通れなくなっている。Heavy snowfall has rendered some roads impassable.

◇ ~ため: means sake, purpose, reason, cause or result.  
・Used to express the purpose or reason of an action or the result or consequence of a situation. 
・急に店を休みにしたのは冷蔵庫の調子が悪いためだ。The reason for the sudden closing of the restaurant was because of a bad refrigerator.  
・体調が悪いため、今日は仕事を休みました。I took the day off work today because I am not feeling well.  
・ファイルのロケーションのため、現在制限されています。Currently restricted due to file location. 
・ライセンス数不足のため、ログインできません。Cannot log in due to insufficient number of licenses. 
・同期のため、テキストとデータベースを検索中。Searching text and database for synchronization. 
・セキュリティ制限のため、接続できません。Unable to connect due to security restrictions.

◇ ~ために means for, in order to, for the benefit of, because of or as a result of.  
・To indicate the purpose or goal of an action.  
・To indicate the cause or reason of a situation or phenomenon. 
・It can be attached to verbs, nouns, adjectives, and clauses. 
・日本へ旅行をするために、貯金しています。I’m saving money in order to travel to Japan. 
・健康のために、毎朝に走っています。I go running every morning for my health. 
・このスーツは面接のために買いました。I bought this suit for the interview. 
・これらは販促のやりとりの効率性を追跡するために使用されます。They are used to track the efficiency of promotional interactions. 
・今日は暑かったために、何もする気にならなかった。I didn’t feel like doing anything today because it was hot. 
・血圧が低かったために、倒れそうになった。I thought I was going to collapse as a result of having low blood pressure.

◇ ~ための means for, for the sake of or for the purpose of.  
・Indicates that the modified noun is intended or needed for the sake of the modifier.  
・It is used to modify a noun with another noun, adjective or verb. 
・これは私の誕生日のためのケーキです。This is a cake for my birthday.
・これは勉強のための本です。This is a book for the purpose of studying.
・これは彼女の幸せのためのプレゼントです。This is a present for the sake of her happiness. 
・これは環境保護のための活動です。This is an activity for the sake of environmental protection. 
・これは英語の勉強のためのアプリです。This is an app for the purpose of studying English. 
・多くの電子キーマシンのための新しいオプション機能。New optional features for many electronic key machines.

◇ ~まま means as it is, current state or without changing.  
・Can be used to express something that remains in the same condition or situation or to express a lack of change or intervention. 
・It can be attached to nouns or verbs. 
・私のふるさとの景色は子どものころのまま変わっていない。The landscape of my hometown has not changed since I was a child. 
・エアコンをつけたまま、家を出てしまった。I left the house with the air conditioner on. 
・片付けはせず、そのままにしておいてください。Do not clean up and leave it as is. 
・彼は自分の気持ちのままに行動する。He acts according to his feelings. 
・この野菜は、生のままで食べてもおいしいですよ。This vegetable is delicious eaten raw.  
・子供のままでいるのは楽しい。It is fun to stay in the same way as a child.

◇ ~ つつ means while or continuously.  
・Expresses that two actions or states are happening simultaneously or continuously. 
・Used to express a contrast or contradiction between two actions or states, especially when followed by も. 
・Suffix that attaches to the stem form of verbs. 
・諸事情を考慮しつつ計画を立てる。To make a plan while considering various circumstances. 
・大声で叫びつつ走りだす。To run away while screaming loudly. 
・アイスクリームを食べつつ、歩いた。I walked while eating ice cream. 
・彼女は泣きつつ話した。She talked while crying. 
・いけないと知りつつも、ゴミを分別せずに捨ててしまう。Even though I know it is wrong, I throw away my garbage without separating it. 
・今日こそ頑張ろうと思いつつ、また運動しなかった。Although I told myself from today I was gonna do my best, I ended up not exercising again.

◇ ~ とともに means together with, at the same time as or as well as.  
・Indicate that two actions or states happen simultaneously or immediately after each other.  
・Indicate that something changes or develops in accordance with or following something else. 
・Indicate that something is also true or possible in addition to something else.  
・Indicate that something happens or is done together with someone or something else.  
・Attached to verbs, nouns, adjectives or clauses. 
・気温が上がるとともに、体調が悪くなる人が増えてきた。As the temperature rises, more and more people are getting sick. 
・高校卒業とともに、引っ越しをして東京で仕事を始めた。Upon graduation from high school, he moved and began working in Tokyo. 
・世界はスマートフォンの普及とともに、大きく変化した。The world has changed dramatically with the spread of smartphones. 
・この店は安くて美味しいとともに、サービスも良い。This shop is cheap and delicious as well as having good service. 
・私は政府とともに仕事をする。I will work together with the government.
